1.content:
My name is Samuel Bane, I'm a twenty two year old deep sea diver and test pilot. I work for my family business, a ocean research company in Orlando that explores the secrets and mysteries of the oceans. Looking at the company's latest mini submarine, I was aquifer of anticipation and fear as I was to be the first human to see the bottom of the Puerto Rico Trench to investigate a fifty year old mystery. To say I was nervous would be a huge understatement as I checked, double checked and triple checked every inch of the sub's outer hull, window seals, and equipment a hundred times over. It was not until my girlfriend, Megan Stone pulled me away that I stopped. She was a tall, 21 year old woman with strawberry blond hair, blue eyes, and a doll like frame.

"Come on, Sugar Bear." stating her nickname for me, she said. "Your dad wouldn't send you that deep if he had not checked everything a thousand times over himself."

Smiling, I brushed my longish light brown hair aside, revealing my green eyes. "It doesn't hurt to check things over another thousand times." looking into her eyes, I replied. "This has been tried before with robots, none of them made it without being crushed or the cable snapping or some other mishap."

Megan shuddered. "That's what worries me." she said. "The robots we did manage to bring back up looked like they had been literally torn apart." pausing, she added, "I don't want you to return like that."

"I'll be careful." kissing her, I promised. "The sub is built tough, just like me."

Then, my dad, Thomas Bane came into view. He was a near mirror image of myself. Powerfully built with crew cut light brown hair and green eyes. He smiled, seeing Megan and I together but turned serious as he reached us. "I don't need to tell you that this mission is dangerous, son." looking at me, he said. "If you want to back out, now is the time."

I shook my head. "Go big or go home." smiling, I replied. "We worked too long and too hard to let someone outside of the family to take this mission."

Dad smiled an patted my back. "That's my boy." he said. "Climb aboard, the conditions are perfect but you know the ocean will not allow that for long."

I nodded and gave Megan one long kiss good bye before climbing a ladder to the top of the sub where the hatch was where I entered with dad sealing the hatch behind me. Sitting into the command chair, I turned one of the cameras to see Megan clasping her hands together, crying. It was as if she feared she would never see me again and, although I had the same fear in the back of my mind, I dared not worry her with it as I began checking all the dials and gauges again.

"Can you hear me, Sam?" asked dad's voice over the radio. "Your mom is still stuck in Miami but she gives her love."

"Rodger that." I replied. "Final checks are complete, let's get this sub wet."

"You be careful down there, Sam!" came Megan's voice. she paused, choking with tears. "I love you."

"I love you too, Meg." blowing a kiss, I said. "I'll see you later."

The sub was then lowered into the water and taken down to the ocean floor where I signaled I the surface, saying my last quick goodbyes before hitting a, disconnecting the tether and all communication with the ship. Little did I know my life would dramatically change from there....

Maneuvering the mini sub down into the trench proved to be more difficult than I had first thought. Upon hitting the external lights, I found that there were sunken ships from all eras along the walls on huge cliff hangings, some of them seemed to to have been literally torn apart and I took a few pictures with the external camera to take a record of them. Traveling further down, I kept a sharp eye on the instruments and kept an ear out for any sounds of water leaking in.

"This is incredible." admiring the scene, I whispered. "I never expected to see this may ships down here."

Then, I approached a small yacht that seemed to be just resting on the very edge of a cliff. As I passed it, the wake of my turbines sent it falling off and into the trench. I followed it down, figuring it would clear my path, to find it on the trench floor only I also saw a figure struggling beneath its broken mast. I moved it for a closer look to find what only could have been a young mermaid! "Holy..." I breathed.

The mermaid looked up at me with large fear filled blue eyes as her red hair swayed in the current. Other than the tail, she reminded me of Megan. "It was my carelessness that got her pinned." frowning, I said. "The least I can do it try to get her out from under the wreck."

Only, as I touched the controls for the robot arms in the front of the mini sub, I heard a crack and the distinct sound of water leaking in. Turning in my seat, I saw that one of the side windows had cracked, allowing water to stream in from the outside. I knew I only had a matter of minutes before the pressure of the deep water would crush me but I could not leave the girl to die under the wreckage. "Damn it all." I cursed. "I have to save her."

Moving in, I used the under water torch to cut away at the steel mast that was pinning the mermaid down, hoping to cut through the rusted metal quickly as another crack reached my ears. It took me only a minute to cut the mast in half and I quickly moved to push it off the trapped girl. "Come on!" I yelled, hearing the robot arms strain under the weight. "Move that piece of junk!"

Finally, the mermaid was free and she swam up, looking no worse for wear. She looked at me through the main window of the mini sub and flashed me a grateful smile. I smiled back, just as the sub violently imploded upon me...

What seemed like hours later, I opened my eyes, wondering if my deadly encounter with the trench was a dream until I saw the face of the mermaid I had rescued. She smiled at me as I tried to sit up but found I could not move.

"Rest, you were badly damaged." in a soft melodious voice, she said. "I am Valdam, I thank you for your brave rescue. I rescued you in turn."

"Where am I?" Weakly, I demanded.

The mermaid smiled and replied...
1.title: Decending into Darkness.

choices: You ask how you can breathe
You follow her through the seal
You ask if there are other humans
You ask if you are in Heaven
12.content:
You fall back into unconsciousness, the world going black.

When you next awaken you're alone. Sitting bolt upright you glance around you. You're in a small room that doesn't appear to be made of walls, but some sort of jelly substance. You walk to the wall and prod it, feeling the jelly retaliate and suck back from your finger. It leaves a sticky substance on your skin.

There's only one way out, a clear door in front of you. As you try to leave a merman holding a spear appears. He is broad and muscular, his face a stern frown.

"Where am I?" you ask the man politely. He does nothing but grunt at you.

It is only then that you realise you're in a room completely void of water, you can breathe. They've fashioned a device so humans can breathe under water! You reach a conclusion.

Just then Valdam comes through a seal and into the room. She is beautiful with long golden locks.

"Hello," she smiles at you.

"Hi," you say nervously, a bit unsure of the proper etiquette to address a mermaid.

"Are you ready to see the rest of the city?" she asks you with a wink.

You nod. Then...
12.title: The underwater city of Kraken.

choices: I am approached by a merman doctor.
I am given a series of tests.
I am approched by someone else.
13.content:
The mermaid smiled and replied, "You are on my world."

"On... your world?" Confused, I asked. I shook my head. "I do not understand."

"What you call the Puerto Rico Trench is a portal to parallel worlds." Softly, Valdam explained. "Your people have not yet developed the technology to explore this." She blushed slightly. "It was the transport to my world that destroyed your fragile submersible; I apologize for that."

"Um... are we still underwater?" Wincing, you asked.

Valdam giggled. "Of course we are." Bemused, she said. "Our healers gave you gills so you can breathe here." She sighed. "I am certain you are full of questions but they can wait; you need to rest and regain your strength."

"Just one more question, for now." Worried, I asked. "Will I be able to return home to my world, family, my girlfriend?"

Valdam gave me a sad smile, which worried me more. "Rest, noble voyager." Softly, she said. "We will discuss this and more after you have had some rest." She gave me a light kiss on the forehead. "For now, welcome to Oceania."

She then swam away, leaving me inside what appeared to be a hospital room only underwater.
13.title: On my world.

131.content:
Almost immediately after Valdam left, a middle aged merman swam up to me with a quick kick of his feet before planting them onto the floor. "My name is healer Grain." Calmly, he said. "You are in surprisingly good shape for a thub." He looked at a chart he was holding. "We will keep you here for a few days for observation before discussing your placement among us or your own people."

"Um... what is a thub?" Curious, I asked.

Grain chuckled. "Thub is short for 'transformed human being'." Smiling, he explained. "It is a term used in the medical field but not to identify anyone socially."

"How much of me was changed?" Wincing, I asked.

Grain looked at me for a moment then smiled. "Your normal appearance as you had known it remained fairly intact." Bemused, he replied. "We simply modified your respiratory systems to take the oxygen you need out of the water as you breath." He then pointed at me, adding "Also, your skin was modified to handle living underwater which is why you will find it more coarse than you are used to as well as having webbing between your fingers and toes."

I examined myself and found that Healer Grain was telling the truth. I had webbing between my fingers and my skin was more rough that I was used to. It was almost as if I had scales rather than fleshy skin. "Is there a chance I can return to my own world, my own people." Worried, I demanded. "My father and girlfriend were on the surface when I dived down..."

"Well, that is complicated." Serious, Grain replied. "Both medically and legally on many levels." He sighed. "Valdam should have been more careful when she opened the portal back home."

"So, I was pulled here by accident?" Wincing, I asked.

Grain nodded. "The procedure that had saved your life is permanent." Serious, he explained. "We can send you back but you would likely be seen as an outcast." He frowned. "Worse, you have no knowledge of how to survive in your oceans and would likely not live long. Forcing such misery upon another living being is unthinkable in our society."

"How would I survive here?" Tearing up, I asked.

"We have people here who can teach you." Reassuringly, Gain replied. "If you remain here, you would be placed into a foster family until you are comfortable with living on your own." he smiled. "While it is true we can teach you how to survive in your own oceans, would you be willing to live with being the only one of your kind there while you are among many here?"

With that said, he swam off to allow you to rest and think.
131.title: Complications.

15.content:
"Why... Why do I feel so strange?" still struggling to move, I asked. "Why does my voice sound so high?"

Valdam sighed. "Well, normally, the absorption process takes several hours to be safe." wincing, she said. "However you were so close to death, we had to act quickly so... a large part of you was lost."

"What do you mean lost!?" panicking, I asked. "Are my arms and legs missing!? Is that why I can't move!?"

"Easy little one." trying to be calming, Valdam said. "Both your arms and legs are intact, you're merely smaller, younger." then, more softly, she added, "You are also a girl."

For a moment, I stared at her stunned. Apparently, the silence unnerved Valdam as she pulled a large mirror over my body so I could see for myself. "I am truly sorry, little one." tearing up, she said. "You are alive but you are a little girl now."

Looking at the mirror, I saw a naked little girl with long flowing sea green hair, lying on a padded table where I should have been. I had light green scales covering my entire feminine body and small, clawed hands. My lips trembled as the gravity of my situation began to sink in. My cat like eyes swelled with tears, changing from hazel to indigo.

Valdam saw my tears and desperately tried to comfort me but it was too late, I screamed at the top of my lungs.
15.title: Reduced to a little girl.

153.content:
Almost as if on cue, a powerfully built man with scaly skin hurried into the room only to stop before Valdam, trying to comfort me as I continued to scream. Seeing the man, I screamed more until he sighed and began to make a deep vibrating sound from inside his throat. I don't know why but it sounded almost like a song and I quickly found myself feeling strangely calm. "Where did you find this female child, Valdam?" stopping his 'song', the man asked. "You know as well as I do that it is forbidden to absorb human children unless they are a finger tip (an inch) from death."

"Daddy, please, its a long story." wincing, Valdam said. "Give me the time to tell it properly."

Again, the man sighed before pulling up what looked like a chair. "Tell your story carefully." calmly, he warned. "It will determine the severity of your punishment."

Valdam gulped. "I had logged time to search the trench floor for wreckage that may be useful." carefully, she began. "As I was ending my search, I saw a sinking vessel fall towards me; I could not escape in time and I became helplessly pinned under the mast."

"Was the child inside this vessel?" unconvinced, the man asked.

"No, father, the 'female child' was a man in a strange submersible." surprising her father, Valdam said. "He used an odd cutting tool to break the mast and move it off me." pausing, she added, "He saved my life but the submersible imploded shortly after, I returned the favor."

"I see." glancing at me, the man said. "Why is the man now a small female child?"

"I only had seconds to save his life so I ordered the machine to absorb what was left alive and this was the result." quickly, Valdam replied. she then blushed and said, "He became a little girl because I used my own DNA to complete the absorption process; I could not bear to leave him orphaned."

"So, to repay this human male for saving your life, you turned his entire world upside down by making him not only a member of a different species but a different age and gender as well." rising to his feet, the man said. "Young lady, from this light cycle (day) forward, you are responsible for your new sister's well being."

"Yes, father." near tears, Valdam said. "I will take my new responsibility seriously."

"This is not a punishment but a necessity." calmly, the man said. "you chose to make the human male your little sister, you must now face the responsibilities of that decision."

"Um... excuse me." raising my hand, I said. "Can you please explain what happened to me?"

The man walked up to you with a kind smile. "I am Soren, captain of the star vessel, Kraken." gently, he said. "You had a deadly experience with the crushing water pressures outside of this vessel, making it necessary to rebuild your body into a new form." touching my shoulder, he quietly added, "Unfortunately, we only know our anatomy so you were rebuilt into one of us."

"I seem to remember being taller and not a girl." still effected by the calming song, I said.

"That is because there was not much left of you to save, I'm afraid." remaining calm, Soren replied. "As for being a girl, well, my daughter, Valdam decided you would adjust faster being her new little sister."

"Normally, we do not absorb any human unless they are very close to death." chiming in, Valdam explained. "We have absorbed children who had been pulled out to sea by a rip tide or were pulled down with a sinking ship..."

"However, it is against our law to take any human, child or adult, who is healthy and in no danger of death." interrupting, Soren said. "That is why I demanded Valdam to explain herself; the last thing we need at this time is seven billion angry humans raining down on us."

"Okay...." the calming effect still holding me, I said. "What happens to me now?"

"For the moment, you will be taken to our family chambers where you will be welcomed into our family." serious, Soren replied. "Valdam will be watching over you, explaining our laws and customs." he then sighed. "As for me, I will be filling out paperwork, explaining why I suddenly have a second daughter."

With that he walked away, mumbling under his breath....
153.title: A man rushes in.

154.content:
The shock of discovering I had been turned into a little girl was enough to give my body the power to move and I rolled off the table, landing onto my hands and knees on a metal floor. It hurt more than I thought it would and began to cry. Only my fear of the situation was higher than my pain, allowing me to run for the door. Fortunate for me, it was open as it looked more like a hatch than a doorway.

"This isn't happening!" hysterical, I screamed, running. "I'm dreaming! Come Sam, wake up!"

"Please stop, little one!" giving chase, Valdam called. "You could get hurt!"

I barely heard the woman chasing after me, I just wanted to get away, find a quiet place to think things through. I had reached another hall, leading in two directions and paused to try to decide which way to run.

"Little one, please wait and listen to me!" begging Valdam called, running up from behind. "I wish to explain!"

"Leave me alone!" begging myself, I called back. "I need time to think!"

Hearing Valdam drawing closer, I spotted an open door and decided to duck inside and allow her to run pass before going the opposite way. I ran down the hall and quickly jumped through, closing the door slightly more to hide my now small frame. To my fortune, Valdam ran passed without giving the door a second look. I breathed a sigh of relief but it was short lived as I heard a soft, feminine voice in the room, I was not alone.

"Goo cycle." politely, the voice said. "Was ya nay?"

Slowly, my lips trembling, I turned to find a young teenage girl, looking at me with a slight smile on her face. She looked much like me only she had no hair. "I- I'm so- sorry." stammering, I said. "I- I tho-thought thi-this room wa-was empty."

"English?" surprised, the girl said. "Were you just absorbed, little one?"

Crying freely, I slowly nodded. "I'm scared." now shaking, I sobbed.

The girl gave me a look of pity, her eyes turning a slight blue color. "Are you in pain?" drawing closer, she asked. I slowly shook my head and she smiled. "Aw, there there, little one. I can help you... if you let me."

She offered me her hand, smiling gently as I heard footfalls approaching in the hall. What do I do?
154.title: I run off.

1541.content:
Being in a smaller body and the wrong gender was terrifying as it was, not being human anymore only added to my horror and I was not sure who I could trust, if anyone at all. I shook my head, taking a step back as my breathing began to quicken again. Only I ended up finding myself behind the door again, just as a a figure entered the room. I peered from behind the door and froze, seeing that it was Valdam. She approached the girl and, to my surprise, she struck her in the forehead with an open hand! "Goo cycle, Aquarius." said Valdam. "Av ya eye a we feyob?"

The teen girl, Aquarius, eyed me briefly to see my eyes change to an indigo color. She winced then struck Valdam in turn as if it were a strange greeting. "No, I have not seen a little girl!" sharply, she said. "Even if I had, I would not tell you she was behind the door!"

I gasped as Valdam turned to see me hiding behind the door. Although I refused to trust Aquarius, I felt a twinge of betrayal as Valdam closed the hatch like door to prevent my escape and gripped my arm. I screamed and struggled but her grip was like a vice and my new body only had a fraction of my original strength. Only, as I was about to scream at her to let me go, she held up a piece of clothing that looked much like a pair of panties. Seeing them caused me to stop struggling as I remembered I was completely naked and blushed brightly.

"You'll catch a cold if you stay naked for too long, little one." smiling, she said. sighing, she added, "I know you are terrified. Will you trust us enough to help you get dressed?"

My eyes now a pink color, I slowly nodded and Valdam eased her grip, handing me the panties. I slipped them on, feeling the strange fabric against my new skin, it was an odd but not unpleasant sensation. Valdam then handed me what looked like a sleeveless leotard. Blushing further, I slipped it on to find it fit me almost like a second skin as I was then handed a pair of odd shoes that looked more like slippers as they had no laces. As I put them on, I was surprised that they closed up, contouring to the very shape of my foot. "That's better, isn't it?" giggling, Valdam said.

"So what this kid's story?" curious, Aquarius asked. "You know the Tribunal frowns upon absorbing human children."

"This young man was inside a small, strange submersible." turning to Aquarius, Valdam said. "He arrived just after I found myself pinned under a fallen wreckage I did not see coming." her eyes turning a blue color, she added, "He saved my life but the submersible crumbled under the water pressure."

"So you saved his in turn." impressed, Aquarius said, eying you, still blushing. "Why is he now a little girl?"

Valdam blushed. "He was so close to death, I- I panicked." looking guilty, she replied. "I rushed the process, causing a random rebuilding of his new Gaian body." sighing, she added, "Instead of regenerating his old body, the system took the bio-matter that was still alive and rebuilt him into a little girl."

"Gaian body?" confused, I asked.

"It is who we are, little one." turning back to me, Valdam said. "It is now who you are as well."

I sighed, looking at the two girls as thousands of questions flooded my mind but one in particular was heavy on my mind. "Will I be able to return home, to my family?"

Both Valdam and Aquarius winced, answering my question. "I am truly sorry." her eyes now a deeper blue. "Had I not acted, you would have certainly died. You are one of us now, the air you used to breath is now... deadly to you."

My eyes widened, the realization that I can never return home again hitting me hard. Valdam sighed as she saw my eyes again flood with tears as I...
1541.title: Step back, shy

15412.content:
Valdam sighed as she saw my eyes again flood with tears as I fell to my knees, crying. In my efforts to save the life of a complete stranger, the one I knew had ended and, from I understood, there was no turning back. It was hard to take as I was very happy in my old life and now, I had to start over as a little Gaian girl.

"Wha- What am I-I t-to d-do now?" sobbing, I asked. "I- I do-don't know h-how to b-be a-a girl!"

Aquarius rose a hand to her mouth, hiding a smile as Valdam knelled down to my level and pulled me into a warm hug. "All will be well, little one." softly, she said. "I will take you as my own and help you to adapt." pausing, she said, "I apologize, I never got to ask you your name."

Blushing, you replied, "Samuel Bane. My friends call me Sam."

"Sam does not sound like a proper name for a girl." smiling, Aquarius stated. "Maybe Samantha."

I winced at that suggestion. "If I'm going to be stuck as a girl, where ever we are, I'd like to pick my own name." gathering some courage, I said. "If I were born a girl, my mom would have called me Kailani. It's Hawaiian for ocean."

Valdam smiled. "Well then... Kailani." giggling, she said. "Welcome to the city of Kraken. It and the city we call Leviathan rests in a massive under sea cavern below what you call the Puerto Rico Trench."

My eyes widened again, stunned. "We're still below the ocean!?"

"Of course we are." smiling, Aquarius replied. "We've been here for the passed fifty star cycles."

"So the impact... was your arrival here on Earth." shocked, I said. I giggled, my first since my transformation. "I just solved the mystery." sighing, I added, "Too bad I can't share my discovery."

"It's for the best, Kailani." comforting me, Valdam said. "Your world is not yet ready."

Then a firm knock came to the hatch like door as a male voice reached them. "Ope en de nay o Moro!"

Both Valdam and Aquarius gasped. "Shit!, It's Moro!" whispering Valdam said. "I was hoping for more time!"

"I have to answer, Valdam." said Aquarius, walking to the door. "I hope you have a plan."

With that, she opened the door to find Moro...
15412.title: A new name in a new world.

154121.content:
Seeing Moro, I let out a screech of fright and almost instinctively hid behind Valdam as he was the scariest looking person I had seen since I had awakened. He looked like human lizard but with no tail. His skin was covered in scales only they were so tightly packed the spaces between almost appeared drawn on.

Valdam looked down at me and sighed before turning to Moro, annoyed. "Moro, you scared her!" scolding, she said. "I had just got her to calm down!"

She then leaned in close and I was able to see her clearly for the first time. She had greenish brown skin, covered in scales, with red eyes and reddish hair that looked more blue in the strange light. She was wearing a blue lip color that made her strangely attractive. Only I darted back to the man, Moro as he spoke in strict but calm manner.

"I detected an odd drain in power and discovered that there had been an unauthorized use of the absorption chamber." eying me, he said. "Absorbing a child is a very delicate process, one you are not trained to do!"

"This was not a child!" countering, Valdam shouted. "Not at first!"

Moro sighed, a growl echoing in his throat but before he could utter a word, a small boy with greenish scaly skin and curiously ivory colored eyes came into view. He wore a leotard type outfit, similar to what I was wearing only mine came with a short skirt, his did not. "Goo cycle." seeing me, he said. "Was ya nay?"

Not understanding the language, I tilted my heads to the side. "Huh?"

Moro placed a hand onto the boy's shoulder. "Esa, Coy, dis feyob no eek or lingo." calmly, he said. pausing, he then said, "She apparently speaks English."

"Ah." nodding, the boy said. turning to me, he asked, "May I please have your name?"

"I- I was Sam." nervous, I replied. "Now... I'm Kailani."

"A beautiful name." smiling, Coy said. "It suits one so pretty."

I blushed at that, not realizing that my eyes had turned pink. "Th- Thank you." shyly, I said.

"Valdam, I must ask you to come with me to the Tribunal chambers." seriously, Moro said. "I must ask that you... Kailani, come as well."

I gulped but Coy chimed in, "You are not in trouble, Kailani but you they will still want to meet you."

"My son speaks the truth." frowning, Moro said. "You have been brought forth into our world for whatever reason, arrangements must be made for you to live here as you can no longer live anywhere else." turning to Valdam, he added, "We can keep this low key or make it an official arrest, it's up to you."
154121.title: Alone with a boy.

1541211.content:
Moro and Coy led me, Valdam, and Aquarius through a number of halls. As we followed, I found myself being held and guided by the iron hand of Moro, as if he feared I would run off. As he did, he was speaking his strange language through a hands free device while also talking with Valdam, no doubt reporting the situation to this Tribunal. Curious, I looked about, to find that the 'streets' of Kraken were busy but not congested with a number of what appeared to be shops and businesses through hatch like doors. Finally, we stopped at a set of massive doors deep within the city. "This used to be the captain's quarters, where he and his family lived." looking at me, Moro explained. "Now, it serves as the hall of the Tribunal, those who govern our laws."

With that, he placed his hand onto a panel, which scanned his hand before a voice came over a speaker. "Enter, Moro." serious, the voice said. "We have much to discuss with you and the new Gaian."

The doors opened with a low rumble and I followed Moro inside to a huge chamber that looked much like a military court room I had seen in various movies only it had a more science fiction theme to it as I saw three Gaians, two males and one female, sitting behind a large desk with a monitor on each side of them and three other Gaians sitting behind slightly smaller desks on either side of the monitors in a large 'C' pattern. "Welcome to the Tribunal, new Gaian." politely, the woman in the center of the group said. "I am judge Vanhallen, to my right is judge Merlin and to my left is judge Skidrow. The three people on the far right represent the citizens of Leviathan and the people on the far left represent the citizens of Kraken. May we have your name?"

"Samuel Bane." bowing, I replied. "Only that name no longer suits me, I have chosen the name Kailani." pausing, I asked, "The monitors?"

"They are links to the city of Olympia and the city of Skyaira only that is a discussion for another time." patiently, Merlin replied. "I apologize for your predicament as you must now grow up all over again as a member of the opposite sex and a different species."

"Once you are absorbed, there is no turning back... Kailani." somewhat sadly, judge Skidrow said. "You are here so to determine your fate. Also, there is a question of jurisdiction. You were absorbed in the city of Kraken by a citizen of Leviathan who, although botched the job, saved your life in return for your heroics."

I swallowed hard. "What is to become of me?" tearing up, I asked.
1541211.title: The Tribunal.

15412111.content:
"We must first understand the situation completely." calmly, judge Merlin said. "Valdam, you had logged in time to search for supplies on the ocean floor outside the cavern. Is this when you encountered the 'strange submersible'?"

"Yes, sir Merlin." bowing, Valdam replied. "A wreck I had not seen coming pinned me to the ocean floor. I was about to panic when the submersible arrived with a human man piloting it."

"A human... man?" surprised, judge Vanhallen asked. she let out a short laugh that sounded like she were gulping water, covering her mouth as if to be polite. "Forgive my reaction, Kailani." composing herself, she said. "I do realize that waking to this transformation you had under gone must be a terrifying experience for you."

I nodded, fighting the urge to cry. "Yes, ma'am."

"On the positive side, you are alive where otherwise, you would have been dead." sincerely, judge Skidrow said. "I trust you used your submersible to help free Valdam from the wreckage?"

"Yes, sir Skidrow." politely, I replied. "It was my submersible that inadvertently caused the wreckage to fall." wincing, I added, "I felt responsible for the woman's predicament so I did what I could to free her. It was the moment she was free that I heard the wall around me caving in."

The three judges turned to each other, surprised then turned to you and Valdam. "You made a mistake, Kailani but you also worked to correct that mistake." said judge Vanhallen. "Your reward was a new chance at life."

"Valdam, you acted quickly to save the life of your rescuer." sternly judge Merlin said. "However, you made the mistake of panicking and did not perform the absorption process properly, reducing the once human man into a small Gaian girl."

"As such, our judgement is thus." eying you and Valdam, judge Skid row said. "Kailani, you shall become a citizen of Kraken with the privileges and responsibilities that go with it."

"Valdam, you shall transfer to the city of Kraken immediately to serve as Kailani's guardian until a proper family can be assigned to her." seriously, judge Vanhallen said. "Living quarters will be assigned to you and Kailani's education will commence within a week." with a sly grin, she added, "If you prove yourself a proper mother to the child and wish to remain her guardian, citizenship to Kraken will be made available to you."

"There will be no punishments handed down in this case." calmly, judge Merlin stated. "The start of a new life for both of you shall be stressful enough." he then smiled turning to me. "Welcome to the city of Kraken, Kailani. May you find this new life more rewarding than the old."

"This hearing is adjourned!" announced judge Skidrow. "All parties are dismissed!"

Upon being led out of the Tribunal chambers, Valdam gave me a weak smile. "Would you like a tour of your new home?" whispering, she asked. "It would help to know your way around."

Knowing Valdam was trying, I returned her weak smile. "Sure, I guess."

"My son and I shall accompany you two." smiling, Moro said. "I'm on my off shift anyway and need to bond with Coy."

Valdam reluctantly agreed and the group began the tour...
15412111.title: The hearing begins.

154121112.content:
Back on the surface, Thomas feverishly worked the controls of the robot submersible, trying to find my ship. Megan was in tears, looking at the camera screens. "He's been down there too long." sobbing, she muttered. "Where is he?"

"We've reached the bottom of the trench." looking at the same camera screens, Thomas announced. "Sam has to be down here as I didn't see any signs of it on the way down."

It was then, to their horror, they found the crumpled wreck of the submersible, with your blood on the inside, silently resting on the trench floor. A blood chilling scream echoed from Megan's throat before she buried her face into Thomas' shoulder, crying hysterically. Thomas continued staring at the screen and found the mast of a large yacht near the submersible had been burned off. "The yacht must have fallen free from a ledge and landed on the sub, pinning it down." he whispered, not knowing how close to the truth he was. "It had to have damaged the ship and caused it to implode just as Sam got himself free from the wreck."

"He promised he'd be back!" distraught, Megan screamed. "He promised he'd be careful!"

Thomas could do nothing to comfort Megan as he was distraught himself but paused as he noticed something strange. "Wait a minute." touching the controls, he said. "What's this?"

Megan turned to look and became confused as well as she saw a shadow moving away from the floor of the trench. "Another submersible?" surprised, she asked. "What the hell?"

Thomas grabbed a pair of binoculars and ran up to the deck. Taking a moment, he carefully looked all around, finding no ship in the distance. "This is very strange." becoming nervous, he said. "Who could possibly have a sub that can go that deep without the need of a ship to launch from?"

"May... Maybe, whoever it is found Sam and saved him." hopeful, Megan suggested. "They may be on their way up to return him as we speak."

Thomas, not wanting to raise any hopes, looked at the screen again, only to see the submersible fire something that looked like a slow moving laser before the screens went out. "Somehow I do not think they are very friendly." sweat beading on his face, Thomas said. "Only I agree that this means Sam may still be alive." knotting his jaws in decision, he turned to Megan. "Mark these coordinates while I get us out of here!" sternly, he ordered. "What evere took out the robot may come for us next!"

"We- We're leaving!?" shocked, Megan asked.

"No time to explain!" quickly, Thomas yelled. "Just do as I say!"

While Megan marked the spot on the navigational map, Thomas took the wheel and pushed the ship into full throttle. "Hang on, Sam!" he muttered to himself. "If you are still alive, I'll get you back!" he shivered slightly, feeling the heat of his own anger. "If you're dead, you can be damned sure I'll avenge you!"

Meanwhile, in the city of Kraken, a man looked at a camera monitor inside a small room and sighed. "Such a fragile little device." shaking his head, he muttered. "All I did was have the remote probe try to access its computer system and the silly thing overloaded."

In another part of the city, my tour took me to the various shops and eateries. I was thankful to have acquired a taste for seafood as it seemed to take up most of the Gaian's diet. It was very surprising to learn that the Gaians were very physical with everything they did. Their idea of a handshake was a smack to the front or back of the head.

"What do you think of the city of Kraken so far, Kailani?" walking with me, Valdam asked.

"It's different, that's for sure." giggling, I said. then I sighed. "Megan..."

Moro frowned. "You are worried about this Megan." looking at me, he said. "I am sorry but you can no longer live on the surface world. The air there is too thick for you now, you would suffocate within minutes." sighing, he added, "Even if you could breath the air, you would be an outcast among your own people. Either way, the life you once knew is over."

I began to sob, even though I knew it was the truth and Coy placed an arm around my shoulders. This sent a heavy wave of pleasure through me, making me blush brightly. "Oh God!" feeling disturbed, I thought. "Don't tell me I getting turned on by this boy already!"

"There is so much to be discovered here in Kraken and even in the city of Leviathan." trying to be of comfort, he said. "We may be of different nations but we are all Gaians... that includes you, Kailani."

"Um... thank you." blushing brightly, I said. "Could you stop that, it's freaking me out."

Coy looked at me, confused. "huh?"

Moro gave a slight gulping chuckle as he pulled Coy's arm off of me. "Ehs no desu ot yobs 'uching' reh." emphasizing the word 'uching', he whispered.

Coy blushed brightly at that. "Sorry, I forgot you were a grown boy." looking at me, he said. "I did not mean to touch your pleasure points."

"Pleasure points!?" startled, I asked.

"From transmissions we have intercepted from what I believe you call radio and television, blowing in one's ear creates a pleasurable feeling." explaining, Valdam said. "Caressing the back of the neck creates the same effect for Gaian girls, its the front of the neck for boys."

Hearing this made me blush even more as I turned to Coy. "It- It's alright, Coy." softly, I said.

Coy nodded, still blushing but Moro spoke up before the awkward feeling set in. "Let's move on." smiling, he said. "I think Kailani would like to see...
154121112.title: On the surface...

1541211121.content:
"You have shuttles?" surprised, I asked.

Moro gave his gulping laugh. "The city of Kraken and Leviathan were once spaceships." smiling he said. "Did Valdam not explain this to you?"

"She mentioned that your people had been down here for fifty sun cycles." blushing slightly, I said. "I'm guessing that means years so I figured you had crashed here fifty years ago."

"Crash landed." correcting me, Valdam said. "The original plan was for the Kraken and Leviathan to meet in orbit around your world. The Kraken was to land in the Puerto Rico Trench while the Leviathan lands in the Mariana Trench."

"Unfortunately, both ships came out of space jump too close to each other and collided." added Moro. "As neither ship had fully materialized both captains desperately tried to steer out of the way but, the ships became solid and the two were fused into one."

"In a desperate attempt to save everyone, the two captains worked together to steer the fused and crippled ships into the nearest trench." chiming in, Valdam said. "They both feared they would soon lose power."

"The Puerto Rico Trench." stunned, I whispered.

Moro nodded. "We focused all remaining power on the cloaking devices and shields." continuing the story, Moro said. "The shields held but the cloaking devices only kept us from being seen by organic eyes."

"That's why the impact was detected by our satellites." hanging on every word, I said. "So you rebuilt the spaceships to function as underwater cities?"

"That is correct." speaking up, Valdam said. "It was our intention all along." sighing, she added, "We only wish to share this Earth without being seen."

"Why did you come here?" curious, I asked.

"Our planet is dying, Kailani." sadly, Moro said. "We learned too late the price of greed for fossil fuels." he placed a hand onto my shoulder. "Your race is beginning to learn this lesson a little earlier than we did and we all pray it is not too late for your species."

We walked in silence for a while after that. Moro's words echoed in my mind as I thought back to my family's efforts to protect the oceans. I had become lost in thought until Moro announced, "Welcome to shuttle bay one."

I looked up and was surprised to see a number of strange looking shuttles, all made to look like creatures of the deep. Noticing my expression, Moro laughed. "We try to remain unnoticed by humans until the time is right." smiling, he said. "These shuttles had been modified since our arrival so to move through the waters without raising human interest."

Walking to one shuttle, modified to look like a stingray, I was surprised by how well it resembled the real thing.

"This is a simple two seat shuttle, used to carry delegates to and from the city of Olympia." explaining, Moro said. "This one will be leaving soon with two such delegates to try to form a trade agreement with the Aquarians."

"The who?" confused, I asked.

Valdam giggled. "They are who you might call merpeople, Kailani." amused, she explained. "There is much about your own oceans you do not understand."

Moro gave a strange command and the back underside of the shuttle opened, revealing the inside. "Let me show you how it works." offering, he said.

You smiled and walked into the shuttle with Coy following. "Careful not to touch any of the controls." serious, he said.

Just then, the room shook violently, throwing you and Coy to the floor of the shuttle. "It's a sea quake!" struggling to maintain his balance, Moro announced. "Remain calm, it will pass!"

The shaking continued, unnerving you slightly. Spotting what looked like a helmet, you grabbed and put it on, hoping it would provide protection. Coy, seeing this, laughed and reached to grab one of his own. Only he missed and the helmet fell onto the controls, closing the shuttle's hatch and activating the engines. "Oh arc!" cursing, Coy yelled. "Get into a seat, Kailani! Hurry!"

The urgency in Coy's voice moved me to obey immediately as Coy quickly threw on the other helmet and strapped himself into the second seat. "I guess we've been selected to be the delegates." nervously laughing, he said.

Hearing the shuttle's engines start, Moro and Valdam ran into a small room and sealed the door just as alarms went off before two large doors opened, flooding the bay with sea water. The stingray like shuttle launched itself off the bay floor and fired off its thrusters, sending it onto its programed course with Coy and I going along for the ride.

"The quake must have activated the pre-programed launch sequence." sighing, he muttered. "I had better alert Olympia that they are about to receive two young guests." managing a smile, he added, "Kailani is in for quite the adventure."
1541211121.title: the shuttle bays.

15412111211.content:
"Well, I've always wanted to explore the ocean." sighing, I said. "I guess now is my chance." a smile forming, I added, "It's beautiful down here."

"This is just the cavern dad and the other made when they arrived here." sighing, Coy replied. "They sealed the hole behind them to ensure they would not be found by humans for centuries." giving a gulping laugh, he then said, "The real beauty is on the ocean floor, beyond the trench."

As we exited the cavern, I gasped. There, on the trench floor was the remains of my submersible, crushed and distorted with a significant amount of blood stained onto the inside walls. I began to cry, looking at it. Then spotted my dad's robot diver, burned out, on the floor near it and began to wail. The fact that my old life was over had finally sank in and the beginning of my new life did not seem to be at the greatest of starts. "I-I'll nev-never see-see them aga-again!" sobbing, I yelled. "D-Dad, Mo-Mom, Me-Megan!"

Wanting to comfort me but not knowing how, Coy touched my hand, getting my attention. "I don't know much about the surface but there is much to see in my world." smiling, he said. "I was told that we live up to 450 to 500 years and, as we become more one with this Earth, that number will grow."

"Five hundred years?" stunned, I asked. "How old are you?"

"Oh, I only eight." lightly, Coy replied. "I'd say you were about ten or so. The absorption process computers would have your exact new age recorded."

"I'm guessing, err, we can not breath under water." curious, I said. "Why land at the bottom of the ocean?"

"We can change our bodies to suit any environment." simply, Coy replied. "Only it does not last long as our bodies will eventually revert back to normal, you must concentrate hard to keep it up but it gets easier each time." smiling, he added, "My dad can maintain a form for seven days before needing to change back."

"I see, so its a matter of practice." curious, I said. "That's interesting."

Coy nodded. "We could go onto the surface, in an emergency." wincing, he said. "Only, the change would not last very long and the change back would be so subtle, as we are humanoid, we would not notice until it was too late."

You sighed, wanting to scream. "Anything you can tell me about these Aquarians?" changing the subject, I asked.

"They are a strange looking lot, that much is certain." smiling, Coy replied. "Only, I was always told that we look just as odd to them as they do to us. We must respect those differences in looks and thoughts."

I nodded, impressed with Coy's maturity but smiled as he then asked, "What of the surface world? What foods do they eat? Do they have music there? Are there any places to play?"

"Whoa! Easy!" Giggling, I said. "Humans eat a large variety of foods, depending on where you go, we listen to all kinds of music and yes, there are a lot of places to play."

For the next hour, Coy and I exchanged stories of each others world. I was amazed to learn that a smack to the back or front of the head was their version of a handshake. I was shocked to learn that girls formerly greet each other by cupping the others breasts. "It's only girl on girl." blushing, Coy said. "If a boy does it to a girl he might get something pulled he doesn't want touched."

I blushed at that even more but, before I could speak, Coy suddenly looked out the window and gasped. "We're here!" excited, he said. "Those are the welcoming arches!"

I looked out and saw a row of stone arches with beautiful coral flowers and volcanic glass designs, making them a breathtaking sight to see. "It's beautiful." I said. then I saw the city. "Oh, wow!"

The city rested inside what looked like an ancient meteor creator. I was not sure where on the map we were but I guessed that the city was shielded from human view somehow. Then Coy touched my hand. "When we land, remember to be formal." said Coy. "Dad will be very upset with us both if we make the wrong first impression."

I nodded then watched as we approached a beautiful castle that seemed to have made from pure crystal. Standing at the front steps were two mermaids and a small mer-boy. I guessed they were the 'welcoming committee'. Once the shuttle had touched down, Coy and I unbuckled ourselves from the seats as the door opened for us, flooding the shuttle with sea water. At first I panicked but Coy smiled.

"These helmets allow us to breath underwater without changing our bodies." explaining, he said. "It's a good thing as we may be here a while." he sighed. "We best not keep them waiting."

Nervous, I swam out first and peered at the three Aquarians. They indeed looked much different from Coy and myself but I saw nothing wrong with that. Still, I was frightened as I seemed to be now representing my new home. "Um... hi."

The tallest of the two mermaids smiled at us. "Welcome, noble travelers." politely, she said. "I am Calypso, queen of Olympia, this my daughter, Hera and my grandson Alexaries." she paused, looking as if she wanted to laugh. "To be honest, I was expecting someone a little older."

"Queen!?" I quickly bowed before her, still uncomfortable with the 'formal' way of Gaian greetings.

"We were... accidentally elected." also bowing, Coy replied.

Unknown to Coy or I, Moro had called ahead, telling the Aquarians of the incident that had sent us their way and to expect our arrival. He also told her I was once human. Calypso found it amusing.
15412111211.title: journey to Olympia.

154121112111.content:
"I know; we were notified of your impending arrival." smiling, Calypso said.

Looking at the merboy, I slowly swam over and said, "H-Hi, I'm Kailani."

"Alexaries." smiling, the boy said. "You can call me Alex."

"It's nice to meet you, Alex." blushing slightly, I replied.

Looking from me to Coy, Alex asked, "Wh-Which one of you was human?"

"That would be me." to Alex's surprise, I said. "I- I used to male as well."

Calypso turned to me, surprised as well. "Why did they change your gender?" curious, she asked. "I heard their method of rebirthing was more advanced than that."

"All I know is that Valdam, the woman who... err... rebirthed me, panicked and sped up the process." blushing more, I said. "I guess it caused the equipment to take what was left alive in me and create a new form." tearing up, I added, "The form of a little girl... I was a twenty two year old man."

Calypso paled slightly. "I see..." softly, she said. "This must be a major adjustment for you, Kailani."

I nodded, trying not to cry. "I'm still trying to wrap my head around it." my voice quivering, I replied. "I-I'm sor-sorry if I- I see-seem out of- of line bu- but..."

I began to cry again but before anyone could react, Calypso touched my shoulder, startling me. "I do not know the details of your plight, Kailani." her tail turning slightly blue, she told me. "However, I can tell you this... your life is not over, just turning into a new chapter." motioning with her hand, she added, "Why don't I give you two a little tour?"

Coy and I nodded and Calypso turned to Hera and Alex. "I leave them in your hands, Hera." hiding a smile, she said. "Do summon me if you need my help."

With that she swam off with the guards following while I noticed a hint of green and red forming on Hera's tail...
154121112111.title: continue.

1541211121111.content:
"Patience, Hera." muttering, she said to herself. "Mother is giving you a chance to prove yourself."

"Um... Hera." nervous, I said. "Are you okay?"

Hera turned to me, smiling, though her tail was shifting colors. I could only guess she was feeling conflicted emotions but I decided it best not to ask for the moment. "I'm fine, Kailani." gently taking my hand, she said. "Please, allow me."

I nodded and allowed Hera to carry me as she swam up, with Alex and Coy following. To my surprise, Coy was keeping up well, wiggling his body like a snake through the water. Hera soon stopped and I found myself about twenty five feet above the ocean floor as she pointed at the city. "Behold the city of Olympia." smiling, she said. "Beautiful isn't it?"

My eyes widened in wonder as I gazed upon what could only have been described as the ancient Greek ruins, restored to their original luster, placed underwater with the palace looking like the Parthenon only made of crystal. Looking up, I saw the surface of the ocean a few hundred feet above me and felt myself tearing up. "Home..." sighing, I whispered.

Hera winced, hearing me. "My son has an idea how you feel, Kailani." gently, she told me. "He was just recently rebirthed as well and is adapting to his new life." pointing down, she added, "Will you at least let me show you what this world has to offer?"

"How is it no one has found your world, Hera?" curious, I asked. "A magical shield or something?"

Hera giggled. "Something like that." releasing me, she said. "There is a shield, set there by a form of magic that makes our city both incorporeal and invisible to humans."

"I see..." impressed, I said. then my stomach growled, causing Hera to giggle again.

"Hungry?" looking at me, she asked.

"Maybe a little." my eyes turning pink, I replied.

Hera giggled again then took me into her arms. "Well, we will get you something to eat..."
1541211121111.title: Taking the tour.

15412111211111.content:
I nodded as I was eager to see more sights. "Okay."

Hera smiled then took Alex's hand. "This way, Kailani, stay close." swimming slowly, she said. "There is much to see." she then turned to Alex. "You too, young man."

Alex blushed slightly, nodding and Hera led us all around the city, pointing out houses, businesses, and schools. "I do not know what sort of school you will be attending, Kailani." looking at you, Hera said. "But this is where Alex will be going in a few days to learn of our people and our way of living."

I had not thought about having to go back to school and found myself blushing at the concept as Hera stopped outside an underwater cave; with massive pillars on each side and heavy doors guarding the interior. "This, Kailani, Alex, and Coy is the Archives." smiling, Hera explained. "This was where we Aquarians of Olympia keep our records; all on what what we call mind pearls."

"Mind pearls?" curious, Alex asked.

"They're pearls about the size of your head." turning to Alex, Hera replied. "They weren't spawned from oysters; only the elders know where they come from."

"It's a good thing they're kept underground." with a worried look, I said. "Humans see pearls as treasures."

Hera shook her head. "How far we have evolved, compared to them." she muttered.

She then turned to us all, sharply, as the doors slowly opened for us. "Everyone focus!" sternly, she said. "This is where the Elders store their knowledge, and the knowledge of others, so that future generations can understand the delicate link that we have with both this world, humans, Misterians, and Gaians we share it with." pausing she allowed her face to soften, adding, "The Elders will be here to answer your questions, you will show them respect at all times."

We all nodded silently. It wasn't long before we were allowed to enter. Once inside I found myself looking around as Coy and Alex were, as this our first visit to the Archives. Swimming through the Entrance Hall, I found myself in a massive chamber. Looking around I saw 50 perfect pearls; resting in nests of seaweed in alcoves along the walls. "Wow, these really are the size of my head!"

I was taking in the beautiful sight when I saw an elderly, but strong, merman swimming out of one of the 20 hallways leading into the chamber.

"Welcome, young ones." pausing, he said, "I'm Kraken, Elder guardian and caretaker of the Archives."

Swimming forward, Coy respectfully bowed before Kraken. "I am Coy of Kraken." smiling he said. "I am honored you were named after my city."

Kraken chuckled. "Actually, Coy, Kraken is a powerful creature of Earth's oceans." amused, she said. "I am honored to be named after him and honored your ship is so named as well."

Coy blushed brightly at his mistake but Kraken did not seem troubled and he soon smiled. "Where did the Aquarians first come from?" politely, he asked.

Kraken touched one of the pearls and we watched as the room changed into a setting on the surface. Looking at everyone, Kraken said, "We were known to the surface dwellers as the Neanderthal. We coexisted with the surface dwellers, living on the land and breathing the air."

A strange figure appeared before us. I turned to Kraken and bowed to him. "Speak, little one." motioning me to rise, Kraken said. "What is your question."

"I am Kailani, recently absorbed human and new citizen of Kraken." rising, I said. "Humans believe that Neanderthals died out thousands of years ago due to unknown circumstances. How did they go from living on land to becoming the Aquarians you are today?"

"To answer your question, Kailani, we evolved and became one with the sea." pausing, Kraken said, "The four brothers; Poseidon, Zeus, Vulcan, and Gaea agreed that the two dwellers of the surface must be parted."

Seeing a story coming, Coy, Alex, and myself gave Kraken our full attention. "This should be interesting." smiling, I thought. "A play on the Roman and Greek Mythology."

"Zeus sent forth a massive stone, forged by Vulcan, to be received by Gaea as a gift to the Neanderthal." explaining, Kraken said. "This stone had magic, placed there by Poseidon, to prepare his new children to come home. With each birth, the Neanderthal became more and more ready to embrace their new identity."

As Kraken spoke the history, adding a little of our religion into the story, we all saw the muscular Neanderthal slowly change; developing scales along their legs and slowly becoming more adapted for ocean life. Kraken paused near the end of his story, giving the class a bright smile of pride. "By the one hundredth birth, the Neanderthal were no more and Aquarians were born." he said, as the image vanished. "So as you can see, children, we do share a certain kinship with the poor surface dwellers." he gave us all a sad look. "Only they're not as blessed as we, so we must remain patient until the day all evolve."

The three of us applauded, but soon fell silent as Coy turned to Alex. Bowing, he said, "Blessed be, prince Alex, who hath evolved!"

Hearing this, Kraken covered his mouth to hide a laugh as Hera smiled, seeing Alex blush before turning to me and stated, "Blessed be Kailani, who hath evolved!"

I blushed brightly at that then smiled as Hera asked Coy, "Would you like to be blessed as well?"

Coy blushed along with Alex and myself but before anything became to uncomfortable, Kraken cleared his throat. "Please continue on your tour and feel free to ask the other elders any question you wish."
15412111211111.title: after the tour.

154121112111112.content:
After a fun tour of the Archives, we all left with Kraken seeing us off. "I hope you found your visit to be enlightening and inspiring, young ones." waving us off, he said. "Take what you have learned and spread the knowledge."

With that, the doors closed with a low but heavy rumble and Hera turned to us. "I think now is a fine time to take a break for a meal." looking at me, she said. "We have many different foods I think you will all like."

I smiled at that but turned to a commotion and screamed as I saw a large group of mermaids, all looking to be in their teens, swimming towards us, squealing, giggling, and cheering. Hera took a hold of Alex and Coy, pulling them back them tried to pull me out of the way but she was not fast enough and I found myself being pulled along with them. I tried to swim out of the crowd but I could not find the room to kick my legs, I was being carried in the middle of the group!

"Please, let me out!" desperate, I yelled.

Only, the helmet I was wearing prevented my voice to be heard over the cheering girls and I found myself carried into a structure that looked much like the Greek Colosseum. Fortunately, I caught a glimpse of Hera following close behind, dragging Alex with her and Coy expertly swimming along side her. I was dragged into the Colosseum by the girls before they finally came to a stop inside what appeared to be a locker room with a grown mermaid watching over them.

"Hurry up, ladies." sternly, she said. "The frenzy game starts in ten tideths!"

"Yes, Oceania!" in unison, the girls replied.

"Why are you wearing that silly thing?" giggling, one of the mermaids asked. "You have to get ready."

I panicked, seeing the mermaid grab my helmet, intending to pull it off of me. Doesn't she see I'm not a mermaid!? "Wait! Stop!" protesting, I yelled.

Then...
154121112111112.title: Leaving the Archives.

1541211121111122.content:
Before the mermaid could pull off my helmet, Oceania swam over. "STOP!"

Blushing, the mermaid said, "Did I do something wrong, Oceania?"

"No, Isis." gesturing to me, Oceania said, "I'd like to speak with her alone."


Once Oceania and I were alone, I said, "Do you know I'm Gaian?"

"Yes, I know." looking at me, Oceania said, "I would've done something sooner; but I had to be certain."

"What are you going to do with me?"

"Nothing, my dear." looking at me, she said, "I believe you're in the care of Princess Hera; so I'll bring her to you."

"No need, Oceania. I'm right here."
1541211121111122.title: Oceania sees me.

15412111211111221.content:
Turning to me, Hera smiled and said, "If you wanted to join the glee squad, all you had to do was ask." she giggled.

I giggled in return, though nervously. "I sort of got caught in the crowd." blushing, I replied.

"Maidens, your attention please." kindly, Oceania called. "Hera, princess of Olympia wishes to speak."

The other mermaids, including Isis, gathered around, looking curious. Seeing them made you feel somewhat awkward but Hera placed a light hand onto your shoulder. "This is Kailani, up to a few hours ago, she was a surface dweller male." not mentioning my past age, she said. "He was absorbed by the Gaians to save his life and is now accompanying a child diplomat from Kraken so 'she' may discover what this new world offers her."

Hera smiled as the mermaids mobbed her, introducing themselves as Isis, Luna, Nautica, Selena, Ionia, and Enceladus who asked to be called simply Elie. "We give glee to our team, rooting them on as they play Frenzy against other cities and tribes of mer-people." she said, excitingly. "Today we're up against Nouveau, a tribe to our north."

"Tribe?" confused, I asked. "You mean like a small city?"

"Tribes are mer-people who have left on their own to build their own communities." softly, Oceania explained. "Some are more friendly than others."

"A conversation for another time." firmly, Hera said. "Kailani is still wrapping her head around being a little girl in a completely different world, let's not hit her with too much at once."

"We have a spare uniform, if you wish to participate in the glee squad." smiling, Isis offered. "You'd look cute in the seaweed skirt and top."

The other girls giggled and voiced their own encouragement before Oceania pulled you away from them. "Kailani is our guest, do not pressure her." sternly, she said. "Finish getting ready."

The girls moaned their disappointment, causing me to blush slightly. "Why not? I'm a little girl now, I might as well try to have some fun." "Actually, it sounds like fun." softly, I said to the girl's delight. "Only, shouldn't you call your team a cheer squad? You know, 'cheering' your team on to victory?"

The girls looked at each other and smiled, giggling. "I like that idea!" smiling brightly, Luna said. "All in favor of becoming a cheer squad?"

The other girls voiced their approval as Elie gave you the spare uniform. "Welcome, fellow, um..."

I smiled. "Cheerleader." blushing more, I said.
15412111211111221.title: I become a cheerleader.

154121112111112211.content:
"The game is simple enough to understand." once we were all dressed, Elie said. "Each team has to try to get a ball into the other team's goal." she pointed to a ships mast on either side of an open clearing with the crows nest hollowed out to make something like a basket. "There are obstacles, of course."

"Such as...?" intrigued, I asked.

"There are two trained dolphins in play, one will try to take the ball from whoever has it and toss it to the other in a funny game mix of keep way and catch." smiling, Ionia said. "It becomes anyone's ball if that happens as anyone can take it from the dolphins while it is being tossed between them and yes, they will give chase." shrugging, she added, "Its all part of the game."

"The dolphins are also there to keep a shark from making a quick snack of a player while focused on the game." serious, Luna added. "Olympia is a safe place but all places have its dangers."

I nodded, remembering the dangers of my hometown on the surface before becoming a Gaian girl. "What is needed to make a win in this frenzy game?" curious, I asked.

"One of two ways." replied Isis, smiling. "One, make ten points before the other team or catch the frenzy before the other team or one of the dolphins do."

"The frenzy?" confused, I asked.

Luna giggled. "It's a small fish that can move faster than anything in the sea, hence its name." smiling, she replied.

"Not only that but its sea green in color so its hard to spot." added Luna. "If a dolphin catches it, the game is called a draw and a new game is scheduled. If our team catches it, we win."

Just then, a small fish swam by with such speed, I had to look twice. Curious, I swam after it, not knowing my body had grown a tail to gain speed. I caught the fish after a minute of chasing and held it up to everyone's shock as my feet returned to 'normal'. "What kind of fish is this?" curious, I asked.

"Kailani, you just caught a frenzy fish!" stunned Isis said.

http://images.china.cn/attachement/jpg/s...

"So that is a frenzy fish." releasing it, I said. "Now I know what to look for when I cheer on the team."

Oceania and Hera looked at me, their faces pale, causing me to worry. "What- What's wrong?"

"Kailani... you better come with me quickly."

"Why?" concerned, I asked. "Is something..."

Suddenly, I found it impossible to breath and I gasped for air, struggling with the helmet over my head. Acting quickly, Oceania and Hera each took an arm and rushed me to the palace. There I was thrown into a pocket of air where I finally tore off the helmet, gasping at the air as I coughed. "What's happening to me!?" terrified, I asked.

"We're going to find out." assuring me, Hera replied.

Hours later, unknown to me, Calypso summoned Adra to her chambers. "I'm afraid I have some grave news, Adra," seriously, she said. "Kailani, the young Gaian girl, her body is rejecting the absorption process."

"What does that mean, exactly?" asked Adra, worried for me.

Calypso sighed. "If we are to have any chance of saving her life, we must act now. We have to...
154121112111112211.title: The game of Frenzy.

1541211121111122111.content:
Shocked, Adra said, “What?”

“The only way to save Kailani is to make her a mermaid; she won’t live long enough for the Gaian’s to correct the problem.”

Sighing, Adra said, “She’s been through so much already; are you sure this is wise?”

“It’s the only way, Adra.” Looking at her, Calypso said, “Surely you can understand the situation; Hera had little choice but to rebirth you.”

“It’s a little different for Kailani, mother.” Sighing, Adra said, “I only changed species once; this would be her second time.”

“I’ve already made my decision; and informed the Gaians.” Swimming up to Adra, Calypso said, “You know what she’s been through; I think it best that you inform Kailani of the decision.”

“Okay.” Sighing, Adra said, “I’ll tell her.
1541211121111122111.title: Make her a mermaid.

15412111211111221111.content:
I was sitting by the pool in the air pocket, soaking my feet in the water when I saw Adra emerge not far from me with a sad look on her face. I winced, noticing this. "Bad news?" worried, I asked.

"We found the problem." wincing, Adra said. "Your body is rejecting the absorption process that made you a little girl, you will turn into a human within the hour."

"Well, that's good, right?" hopefully, I said. "I'll be able to return to my life on the surface."

"Not quite." sadly, Adra replied. "You see, you will become what was left of you before the process began."

I turned pale at that, remembering Valdam telling me there was not much left of me. "So... I'm going die?" crying, I asked. "No chance at all?"

"We can save you by making you a mermaid." wincing again, Adra replied. "Our way is a bit more stable but it would mean you starting all over again."

"As a young mermaid?" still crying, I asked.

Adra sighed and replied....

info.brief_description: The oceans hold many secrets, Samuel Bane becomes lost in one of them.
info.description:
The story begins with a little history. Nearly fifty years ago, NASA detected a sizable impact in the Atlantic Ocean, over the Puerto Rico Trench. This unofficially sparked the Cuban Missile Crisis of 1962 as it moved the US government to investigate. As the years passed, it became less clear what that impact was as no one seemed to have detected such an impact that was large enough to be detected by satellites. Today, a private ocean research company, created a mini sub that they hoped would safely take a man to the bottom of the trench to investigate the age old impact mystery. They send their best deep sea diver and test pilot, Samuel Bane (you) to take on the mission.

The rules are simple.

1. Do not change the names of the characters.
2. The main character can not be killed.
3. Add characters if you wish so long as they fit the story line.
4. Sex is allowed but please keep it age appropriate.
5. Proper spelling and grammar, please.
6. Always leave more than one option.
7. The story is to be in first person (Me, myself, I)
8.If any questions, E-mail me. I don't bite.^^
